entry.title: Top Books by ratio of brilliance to length
entry.summary: My favourite books, ranked by brilliance to length ratio
entry.content:
Here be some books I recommend. If you don't have a lot of time to read but don't want to compromise on brilliance (i.e. can't be bothered to spend a year in which your main occupation is reading the book - looking at you Infinite Jest), then this is the list for you.

  1. Thomas Pynchon - The crying of lot 49
  2. Flann O'brien - At swim-two-birds

entry.title: Top Albums by First Line
entry.summary: Albums rankend by how good of a opening line they have.
entry.content:
What it says on the tin.

  1. Patty Smith - Horses. "Jesus died for somebody's sins, but not mine"
  2. Captain Beefheart and his Magic Band - Trout Mask Replica "My smile is stuck, I cannot go back to your frownland."

entry.title: Top Books by ending
entry.summary: My top books by ending. By ending I mean the actual final sentence or so.
entry.content:
My top books by ending. By ending I mean the actual final fragment, never more than a sentence, followed by the actual quote.

Perhaps the least useful article in my website. If you have read the book, it might make you smirk in recognition, but, brilliant though these bits are, if you haven't read all the preceding pages then they will mean nothing to you. It should't, however, spoil any future readings of the the book.

Inclusion on this list is a recommendation, for sure.

  1. Thomas Pynchon - The Crying of ot 49: "the crying of lot 49."
  2. Flann O'brien - The Third Policeman: "- Is this about a bicycle?"
  3. São Banaboião, Anacoreta e Mártir: "porque demoraste tanto?"

entry.title: 100 Songs
entry.summary: The 100 songs of my life, in autobiographical order
entry.content:
This started as a list of 100 songs that were the track I thought was the best ever, that I would listen to on repeat thinking, this song is the best song ever... until I tired of it. I present them in rough autobiographical order - by which I mean the order, in my life, when I was was so entranced by them.

While some fit that bill entirely, some stand for not a particulary song I used to listen to on repeat, but to an album I was overtaken by.

I also had to add the rule of one band/artist per entry. Otherwise more than half the list would be by two artists.
